intro: Aeschynomene lateritia, commonly known as the tropical sesbania, is a flowering plant species native to tropical regions of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod-bearing fruits. The plant typically grows as an annual herb, reaching heights of up to 1 meter, with slender stems and trifoliate leaves. Its small, yellow flowers are arranged in racemes, and the plant is often found in disturbed soils and along roadsides. Aeschynomene lateritia is also known for its potential use in soil improvement and as a forage crop.
